Hi David,

We used it for collection the logs for each test for separate file.
In the result directory we have directory for each class (the name of
directory is the name of the class) and this directory log file for each
test and another log for the @BeforeClass and another for the
@... that in the report we can give link to each log file when
you press on the test or the @BeforeClass,@AfterClass
You can see example to that report in the attach image where the link of
info is link to the files created during test like the log file.

BTW - We also extend the expectedException to check not only the class but
also the message of the exception.

Is it possible to add timeout for the @BeforeClass, @AfterClass ?

Thanks




http://www.nabble.com/file/p22587993/junit.jpeg 




David Saff wrote:
> 
> Idan72,
> 
> There will be a new release, hopefully soon.
> 
> Can you remind me why listeners for BeforeClass and AfterClass are
> useful to you?  Thanks,
> 
>    David Saff
> 
> On Mon, Mar 16, 2009 at 12:43 PM, idan72 <ishai@...> wrote:
>>
>> Hi,
>>
>> Is there going to be listener that support @BeforeClass and @AfterClass ?
>>
>> I was able to implement this but for doing so I was need to override the
>> junit runners for class,suite and paramerized.
>> I also need to change the AllDefaultPossibilitiesBuilder method to call
>> my
>> runners.
>> In these runner I call myRunBefores and myRunAfters .
>>
>> We are going now to new project.
>> If there will be support in the next release in this feature I will be
>> able
>> to remove lot of code and override of junit classes which will be great.
>>
>> Is there going to be new release ?
>> Are you going to support listener for start and finish of @BeforeClass
>> and
>> @AfterClass ?
>>
>> Thanks
>> --
